definition: table/desk/classifier for tables of guests at a banquet etc

sentences.english: My deskmate is a beautiful girl.
sentences.chinese: 我的同桌是一個漂亮女孩。

sentences.english: She has a deskmate. His names Chen Kangwei.
sentences.chinese: 她有一個同桌，他的名字是陳康偉。

sentences.english: Iraq shares a table, before is always bullied by Iraq, has class leader to support luckily.
sentences.chinese: 伊拉克同桌，以前老被伊拉克欺負，幸好有班長撐腰。

sentences.english: Exchange your exercise books with your neighbor and correct each other's mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 把你的練習本和同桌交換，互相糾錯。

sentences.english: For the rest of time, please ask and answer the questions with your desk mates about the text.
sentences.chinese: 用剩餘的時間，同桌間就課文內容進行相互問答。

sentences.english: Neither I nor my deskmate knows the answer to the question.
sentences.chinese: 我和我同桌都不知道該怎麼回答這個問題。

sentences.english: Listening to the teacher worried of inquiry, leap or my sit at the same table told her reasoning.
sentences.chinese: 聽着閆老師着急的詢問，還是我的同桌告訴了她原委。

sentences.english: The following year, Visa admitted Tsinghua University, the girls became even sat with him.
sentences.chinese: 次年，老狼考上清華，那女孩竟然與他成了同桌。

sentences.english: My new deskmate is a boy of sixteen.
sentences.chinese: 我的新同桌是一個16歲的男孩。

sentences.english: My desk-mate is a pretty girl.
sentences.chinese: 我的同桌是一個秀氣的小姑娘。

sentences.english: The characteristic is looked that resembles stockily but actually insincere, frequently quarrels with the same table of Pakistan.
sentences.chinese: 特點看似敦實卻不厚道，經常和同桌巴基斯坦吵架。

sentences.english: Look at the picture and fill in the blanks.
sentences.chinese: 看圖選詞完成填空，描述給你的同桌聽。

sentences.english: Well done. Now please finish the others in pairs.
sentences.chinese: 下面請同桌相互討論一起完成這張表格。

sentences.english: No, Su Hai's taller than Su Yang. Talk about their results with your partner.
sentences.chinese: 請你和同桌談一談蘇海和蘇陽的體育成績。

definition: to be in the same class/to be in the same squad/classmate
the prettiest girl in the class
to study at the same school/fellow student/classmate/CL:位[wei4],個|个[ge4]
teacher in charge of a class
the most handsome boy in the class
(dialect) close childhood friend whom one grew up with/a couple who grew up as childhood friends
to divide people into groups, teams, squads etc
